sub_title: Supply Chain Director Belgium at Alken-Maes - part of The HEINEKEN Company
summary:
I am a strategist with a practical and process minded way of thinking. As a leader I create clear expectations within a clear framework, where employees can work independently and with confidence.

My ability to both determine the long-term course of a company and translate strategy into realistic short-term plans has helped me in leading succesful projects of change and moving companies forward. 

To get organisational results I always focus on 3 P’s; People, Performance and Progress. 

People
I am a leader, not a boss. I have a genuine interest in the people that I work with and believe that respect is the basis of trust. On that basis we make plans and commit to our part. I strongly believe in “do what you promiss” and act adequately if someone does not deliver on their promiss. People trust me because I am consequent in my actions and clear in my expectations. 

Performance
I am both a people manager and a process manager. I believe every individual has the ability and the need to grow, on whatever level. With the right attention and motivation people can increase their performance and get better results. Processes need to facilitate employees in performing better and therefore need to be clear, efficient and safe. Focus on both human development and proces development gets better organisational results. 

Progress
Standing still is not an option. Not for companies, and not for individuals. I am ambitious and believe that the sky is not the limit. I feel at place in companies that not only look forward but also (want to) move forward. My analytical skills enable me to make ambitious but feasable plans. My leadership skills help engaging employees and making them want to carry out those plans. 

My specialities:
✪ strong persuasive skills
✪ ambition (the sky is the limit)
✪ eagerness to learn
✪ strong sense of responsability 
✪ solution oriented
✪ strong empathic leadership skills
